author: Stephanie Lee
title: You Can Make Your Own Taco Shells Entirely Out of Bacon
text:
Go to permalink 
“You know what would make this 2 a.m. taco perfect? Bacon. No wait, the whole taco shell...just bacon.” I imagine that’s the kind of thought process that would inspire someone to make this. And now The Backyard BBQ Show shows you how it’s done. 
You need a grill and lots of bacon. It’s “real easy,” the video begins, but the first step actually requires some prior knowledge on weaving 15 strips of raw bacon together . Once woven together, lay it out on parchment paper, then place another sheet of parchment paper over to begin molding a taco shape. Basically, you want a circle, so place a nice salad bowl upside down to create a circular imprint and use kitchen scissors to cut the shape out. You can set aside the extra bits of bacon for other bacon-y goodness. Next, you want to form the taco-like shape while it cooks in the grill. The video’s host uses a rib rack. If you don’t have that, you can try something like this to invert the bacon weave. Or roll it up like this so it’s more of a cylindrical shell. Grill the bacon for 20 minutes before flipping it around and cooking for another 20 minutes. In just 40 delicious-smelling minutes, you have a bacon taco shell to stuff with more bacon (if you want) and other taco fixings. Advertisement Advertisement 
Alternatively, you can use the oven to cook it slightly faster. If you’re a bit more calorie conscious, you can swap with turkey bacon. Whatever your feelings toward such a bacon creation, it’s a tantalizing idea for bacon lovers and those of you on a ketogenic , or very low-carb diet.
